mandirs.Name: Shri Banke Bihari Ji Mandir
mandirs.description: Banke Bihari Temple is located in Biharipura in Vrindavan Dham in Mathura district in India. It is one of the ancient and famous temples of India. Banke Bihari is a form of Krishna which is displayed in it. It was constructed by Swami Haridas in 1864.
mandirs.Name: Shri Banke Bihari Ji Mandir
Radha Rani Mandir ( Barsana )
mandirs.description: The Radha Barsana Temple is a Hindu temple in Barsana, India. It is dedicated to Radha, the consort of Krishna, and is one of the most important pilgrimage sites for devotees of Radha and Krishna. The temple is known for its beautiful architecture and spiritual significance.

mandirs.Name: Prem Mandir
mandirs.description: Prem Mandir is located in Vrindavan near Mathura district of Uttar Pradesh state in India. It was constructed by Jagadguru Kripalu Maharaj as a temple of Lord Krishna and Radha. Prem Mandir was inaugurated on 17 February. It took 11 years and an amount of approximately Rs 100 crore to build this temple.
mandirs.Name: Prem Mandir Vrindavan
Iskon Temple Vrindavan
mandirs.description: ISKCON Vrindavan, also called Sri Krishna Balaram Mandir, is one of the major ISKCON temples in the world. It is a Gaudiya Vaishnava temple located in the city of Vrindavan, Mathura district, in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. The temple is dedicated to the Hindu gods Krishna and Balarama. The other deities of temple are Radha Krishna and Gauranga Nityananda.

mandirs.Name: Rang Ji Mandir Vrindavan
mandirs.description: There are many famous temples of Sri Ranganatha of which Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple, Srirangam is the most famous. Shri Ranganath is the form of Lord Vishnu. Although Ranganath Swami is the worshipable deity of all Hindus, Vaishnav people worship him especially. The literal meaning of 'Ranganath' is 'lord of the gathering place'.

mandirs.Name: Janambhumi Mathura
mandirs.description: The Krishna Janmasthan Temple Complex is a group of Hindu temples situated in Mathura, Uttar Pradesh, India. There are three main temples inside the premises -- Keshavdev temple which is dedicated to Krishna, Garbh Griha where Krishna is believed to be born in Dvapar Yuga and Bhagvata Bhavan where presiding deities are Radha Krishna.

mandirs.Name: Radha Raman Mandir
mandirs.description: The Radha Raman Temple is a Hindu temple in Vrindavan, India. It is dedicated to Radha and Krishna, and is one of the oldest temples in the city. The temple was established by Gopala Bhatta Goswami in 1542 CE, and it houses a deity of Radha Raman, a form of Krishna.

mandirs.Name: Radha Vallabh Mandir
mandirs.description: The Radha Vallabh Temple is a Hindu temple in Vrindavan, India. It is dedicated to Radha and Krishna, and is one of the oldest temples in the city. The temple was established by the Vallabha sect in the 16th century, and it houses a deity of Radha Vallabh, a form of Krishna.

mandirs.Name: Nidhivan Mandir
mandirs.description: Nidhivan is a sacred grove in Vrindavan, India, associated with the Hindu deity Krishna. It is believed to be the place where Krishna performed his divine pastimes with Radha and the gopis. The grove is home to many sacred trees and is considered a place of spiritual significance.

mandirs.Name: Radha Gopinath Mandir
mandirs.description: The Radha Gopinath Temple is a Hindu temple in Vrindavan, India. It is dedicated to Radha and Krishna, and is one of the oldest temples in the city. The temple was established by the Gaudiya Vaishnavas in the 16th century, and it houses a deity of Radha Gopinath, a form of Krishna.

mandirs.Name: Radha Madan Mohan Mandir
mandirs.description: The Radha Madan Mohan Temple is a Hindu temple in Vrindavan, India. It is dedicated to Radha and Krishna, and is one of the oldest temples in the city. The temple was established by the Gaudiya Vaishnavas in the 16th century, and it houses a deity of Radha Madan Mohan, a form of Krishna.
